title: Po' Boy Sandwiches
summary: The recipe Po' Boy Sandwiches could satisfy your Creole craving in approximately 15 minutes. This recipe serves 4 and costs $12.49 per serving. This main course has 3426 calories, 335g of protein, and 207g of fat per serving. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of arugula, olive pesto, baguette, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the baguette you could follow this main course with the Baguette and Butter Pudding as a dessert. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 89%. This score is amazing. Similar recipes include Hawaiian Ham and Cheese Sandwiches (aka Tailgate Sandwiches), B.E.G. Sandwiches (Bacon-Egg Griddle Sandwiches), and BST Sandwiches.

winePairing.pairingText: Albarino, ros√© Wine, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Cajun. These low-tannin, lower alcohol wines will complement the heat in spicy cajun dishes, instead of making your mouth burn more. You could try Familia Torres Pazo das Bruxas Albarino. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Familia Torres Pazo das Bruxas Albarino
productMatches.description: Brilliant pale gold color. Delicate and fragrant, with fine floral, lime blossom and lemon marmalade notes. Silky and savory on the palate, elegantly structured.

instructions: Remove the meat from the ribs and shred it with your fingers. Slice each baguette piece in half horizontally. Spread one side of a baguette half with some pesto and layer on some arugula and black olives. Top with some shredded pork and place the other baguette half on top.

steps.step: Remove the meat from the ribs and shred it with your fingers. Slice each baguette piece in half horizontally.
Spread one side of a baguette half with some pesto and layer on some arugula and black olives. Top with some shredded pork and place the other baguette half on top.
